$interpreted: Dylan: The Jersey region has always been a major source of the kingdom's food supplies. Our immediate priority now is to deal with the issues there.
Angelia: That's what I've been thinking as well...
Naya: Angel! I heard that you've placed the entire region north of Jersey under Fredrica's jurisdiction?
Angelia: Yes. I believe General Lucien has the ability to handle the situation.
Naya: It's not about her ability. She was once a direct subordinate of Theodore, but surrendered in an instant.
Naya: These people aren't worthy of our trust!
Dylan: If those who once served under Theodore don't deserve jobs, then half the kingdom would be out of work.
Naya: I know that...but is it really okay for us to entrust such an important mission to her?
Angelia: Naya, I know that you're concerned about me.
Angelia: Despite that, I have to extend an olive branch to those who were once on Theodore's side. That way, they may be willing to serve under me.

Assessment Officer: Queen's orders. Today, the army will undergo a revamp based on individual abilities. If you hear your name called, please step out from the line. 
We will then proceed with your assessment.
Assessment Officer: First one, Robin Williams.
Assessment Officer: Next, Jerome...
Assessment Officer: Jerome Muca!?
Jerome: Here.
Assessment Officer: Sir, why are you here!?
Jerome: Isn't today the day of the assessment?

Assessment Officer: What I meant is, aren't you General Lucien's officer?
A high-ranked officer like sir is not required to go through the assessment.
Jerome: I have resigned from my position as an officer. I no longer serve under the general.
Assessment Officer: Eh...? This....
Jerome: Is it time for my assessment now?
Assessment Officer: ...Alright. Begin.
Jerome: Who should I fight next?
Assessment Officer: Stop, stop, stop. No need. Nobody here stands a chance against you. The tough question for me now...is where exactly should I assign you?
Fredrica: You ain't going anywhere!
Jerome: General, you're drinking during work hours again.
Fredrica: I did not...*hiccup*...drink. You previously just said that you would stay by my side forever...
Jerome: ...As your officer.
Fredrica: And you said some crap about having only me your entire life...
Jerome: ...As a superior I follow.
Jerome: General, stop saying things like this. It'll cause misunderstandings.
Fredrica: Like I give a damn about misunderstandings! You're leaving me anyway.
Fredrica: You heartless bastard, how dare you try to abandon me after playing with me...*hiccup*... I was wrong. You're the same as every bastard out there!
Jerome: No matter what you guys are thinking in your heads right now, it is definitely not what you think it is.
Jerome: General, you're drunk. Here, let me help you up. I'll escort you back too.
Fredrica: I don't need...*hiccup*...your help...
Assessment Officer: I smell something～very fishy!!!
Jerome: General, you should take the day off and rest.
Fredrica: Is it because I surrendered to Angelia? Is that why you're leaving?
Jerome: ...General, you were heavily relied upon by his Majesty Theodore. Why were you willing to surrender so easily?
Fredrica: I never realized that you were so loyal to Theodore~
Jerome: The person I'm loyal to is not Theodore, but you, General!
Jerome: However, right now, I just can't understand what you're thinking. With His Majesty gone missing, shouldn't you be searching for him?
Fredrica: Well, the kingdom is huge~Even if I do want to search for him, wouldn't know where to start. Besides...
Fredrica: Being prone to change is one of a woman's many rights.
Jerome: General, I am being serious. Please don't joke around with me.
Fredrica: I am also being serious, and I am not joking around either.
Fredrica: There's nothing wrong about working under Angelia. The job is stable, the salary is protected, and you get bonuses on holidays as well.
Jerome: ......
Jerome: I am having serious trouble understanding your thoughts. Therefore, I can't continue to follow you. I am very sorry.
Fredrica: ...*sigh*...~ Why do men always leave my side~

That's what I've been thinking as well...

Yes. I believe General Lucien has the ability to handle the situation.
It's not about her ability. She was once a direct subordinate of Theodore, but surrendered in an instant.

If those who once served under Theodore don't deserve jobs, then half the kingdom would be out of work.
I know that...but is it really okay for us to entrust such an important mission to her?

Despite that, I have to extend an olive branch to those who were once on Theodore's side. That way, they may be willing to serve under me.

Well, the kingdom is huge~Even if I do want to search for him, wouldn't know where to start. Besides...
Being prone to change is one of a woman's many rights.
General, I am being serious. Please don't joke around with me.
I am also being serious, and I am not joking around either.
There's nothing wrong about working under Angelia. The job is stable, the salary is protected, and you get bonuses on holidays as well.
I am having serious trouble understanding your thoughts. Therefore, I can't continue to follow you. I am very sorry.
...*sigh*...~ Why do men always leave my side~
